quotes.quote: Being myself includes taking risks with myself, taking risks on new behavior, trying new ways of 'being myself', so that I can see who it is I want to be.
Simply being myself makes me feel vulnerable.
I never went wrong by being myself.
I take a lot of pride in being myself. I'm comfortable with who I am.
I'm terrified of just being myself because I think it's boring. I know who I really am and I think it's boring.
When I'm trusting and being myself as fully as possible, everything in my life reflects this by falling into place easily, often miraculously.
I don’t have to be anything at all. I don’t even have to be myself, because there is no such thing as not being myself. I am inescapably myself.
I have never regarded myself as this or that. I have been too busy being myself to bother about regarding myself.
I try to keep it real. I don’t have time to worry about what I’m projecting to the world. I’m just busy being myself.
If being me offends you, maybe I'm not the problem.
It took a lot of years of me on my own, coaching myself, to look in the mirror and love the reflection.
You really have to look inside yourself and find your own inner strength, and say, 'I'm proud of what I am and who I am, and I'm just going to be myself.'
I allow myself to fail. I allow myself to break. I'm not afraid of my flaws.
It took me years to realize that 'normal' is actually super boring and that being myself was harder but infinitely more rewarding.
I prefer to be true to myself, even at the hazard of incurring the ridicule of others, rather than to be false, and to incur my own abhorrence.
I don’t care what you think about me. I don’t think about you at all.
I will not let anyone walk through my mind with their dirty feet.
Being myself is what got me to where I am.
I’ve always prided myself on being myself and trying to stick true to who I am and how I was raised.
I am not trying to give an image of a fairytale, perfect, everything else, I am just being myself.
I’m just saying I’m being myself, and people understand that.
I think especially since going solo it’s pretty clear that I’m completely being myself.
Sometimes being me is very confusing.
Being me right now is sort of amazing.
Being me is no different than being most anyone else, I guess.
I'm not trying to be different. To me, I'm just being myself.
I'm having fun. I'm being myself. I'm doing what I love. That's all that matters.
I stay true to myself and my style, and I am always pushing myself to be aware of that and be original.
I would classify myself as an individual. That's what I try to stay true with - being myself, 100 percent.
The single most powerful thing I can be is to be myself.
It gets better and better being me
